sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3}. Calculate the cartesian product of A and B, and then find the symmetric difference of the resulting set with the cartesian product of B and A. Show that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
